textPlain: Finally a social network that only true nerdy people will ever join, I might just finally pick up emacs again.

Just last week I was fiddling around with a tangentially related idea. I made some modifications locally to my setup so that when browsing a .org file in eww, org-html-export-as-html would render it in the buffer as HTML directly. eww doesn't really support much styling via shr, so I was working on adding some basic css parsing to expand the range of expression for an org-based blog approach.Many people export their org file based blogs to HTML and then publish them, but my thought would be to skip that and instead provide a path for eww to directly render org files, cutting out my html export stopgap.

This seems less "decentralized social network" and more "html-less www with extra steps," especially since it's only going to allow socializing between the specific types of people who fall within 3 very specific Venn diagram circles who 1) use emacs, 2) use org-mode, and 3) want to go through the trouble of hosting their own section of the network.
This sure is a social network for a very small and specific set of people.
Reminds me of .plan files from back in the day.
What does it solve compared to a normal plain HTML blog?
We kind of already have groups in Gnus... I even messaged one group, like twice in my life.
This looks like a bad hybrid between RSS and Markdown. Am I missing something?
I guess this is an internet for the folks who are still annoyed by the Eternal September?
And also 4) somewhat want to talk to other people ― but not that much that they'd be ready to exit Emacs.
Sort of. There's Org for Vim users :)
In other words, it's a real social network.
Well, there is https://plan.cat   ...which, hosts a user's plan files. :-)I guess think of it as a little microblog for displaying one's plan file?
We're rewriting the books. finger was the first social network!

This filtered out those who 
1) don’t use eMacs
2) don’t use org-modeI suspect org-mode users are willing to go through an extra step if needed.My notes are in .org if I want to share with someone else I export to .md and use the output
